documentation.description: ElectreTriClassAssignments - computes assignments according to the Electre TRI method. It generates separate outputs for the conjuctive ('pessimistic') and disjunctive ('optimistic') assignments.
Classes (categories) to be considered for alternatives assignment. Each class must have its rank provided as an integer, where the lowest number defines the most preferred class.

Outranking matrix (alternatives vs profiles) which should be used in exploitation procedure.
Please note that instead of numeric values for each pair of alternatives/profiles, this matrix should contain the actual types of outranking relations given as strings, i.e. 'preference', 'indifference', 'incomparability' or 'none'. For more on this see documentation for the 'cutRelationCrisp' module, which produces such output.
Resulting class assignments in the conjuctive ('pessimistic') order.
Resulting class assignments in the disjunctive ('optimistic') order.
Messages or errors generated by this module.
